p: Figure 4 shows the dynamics of the bactericidal activity of the oil against 3 Gram negative bacteria. The response of both E. coli and Br. bronchiseptica was quite rapid; more than 99.999% of the exposed cells (ca 10 7 CFU/ml) were killed within 5 min contact with the oil (1% v/v) and no re-growth was detected after that. In contrast, the response of Ps. aeruginosa was distinctly different, exhibiting bilinear response vs. time. The first part of dynamic response was relatively rapid leading to 3 log reductions in the number of cells surviving the first 5 min of incubation. Thereafter, killing rate decreased markedly and, at the end of the experiment (6 h), ca 10 4 CFU/ml was still living.
